context: I wonder which US, Japanese or European company they stole the designs from.

Ah ... thanks, but no thanks.

It's made in Communist China with stolen technology and Chinese workmanship.
It's a flying coffin in essence.

Helicopters at least can auto rotate down in case of engine failure. If just one of those electric motors blows a fuse it's going down.hard. No safety net. I doubt they could even use a parachute because the craft would be spinning.
It's made in China so it probably won't last more than 2 or 3 trips if even that far and they won't support it if it fails - user error.
I can already see someone walking to close to the side and getting sliced and diced.

Interesting innovation. Communist governments flush with Western Tech and money. We created a monster by moving our tech and factories to China. You have to trust their leader, because no one else is in charge in a communist country. At some point they get a snotty self indulgent leader and the rest will be history as they say.
All China has done is scale-up current drone technology, which they initially stole from the US to begin with.
Would you ride a Chinese motorcycle down the freeway? Then why would you EVER step in this?

"The company claims the autonomous flight technology eliminates any chance of failure caused by human error." Humans created everything about this technology: hardware and software" All possible errors are already programmed-in.
